questions.question_text:
A systems administrator is tasked to deploy VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) and has already deployed the VMware Cloud Builder appliance.
What is the next step the systems administrator should take?

choices.B: Configure the Management Domain using custom certificates.
choices.D: Prepare and configure the ESXi hosts to be used in the deployment.
choices.C: Deploy the Management Domain using VMware Cloud Builder.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer. Send the UPS to to Deploy SDDC Manager.

A is correct 

If you don't Upload the Parameter Workbook to cloud builder wizard, you can not proceed with deployment of the Management Domain.

Selected Answer: A
If using VMware Imaging Appliance to install ESXi host, it would be the step after deploying cloud builder. But in the option, it doesn't mention about preparing and configuring hosts using VIA. Hence option A to upload parameter sheet to deploy SDDC Manager is correct option.
A is correct, at this stage you won't suddently go and start preparing the ESXi host
A is correct as the cloud builder is ready and asking for new step

Selected Answer: D
D is correct!

questions.question_text: Which service is integrated with VMware Cloud Foundation and enables a centralized and simplified lifecycle management of ESXi host?

discussion.content:
Corecct answer is C : SPBM
This is because according to VMware documentation34, vSphere with Tanzu uses storage policies to integrate with shared datastores available in your environment, including VMFS, NFS, vSAN, or vVols datastores. The storage policies represent datastores and manage the storage placement of such objects as persistent volumes (PVs).Storage Policy Based Management (SPBM) is a framework that provides a single unified control plane across different types of datastores and enables administrators to define policies based on storage capabilities and requirements

Selected Answer: C
Correct anwer is C
The Cloud Native Storage for vSphere with Tanzu workflow is as follows: 1. A developer deploys a pod using the kubectl CLI.
2. The vSphere with Tanzu Cloud Native Storage-Container Storage Interface (CNS-CSI) reads this request from the control plane API server.
3. CNS-CSI informs the vCenter Server CNS that a disk with gold storage class is required. 4. CNS interfaces with SPBM for a suitable datastore that satisfies the gold storage class (storage policy).
5. SPBM decides on a suitable datastore and interfaces with DRS for a suitable ESXi host. 6. Hostd on the ESXi host creates a first class disk (VMDK) on the datastore. 7. Spherelet on the ESXi host takes the VMDK. 8. Spherelet mounts the VMDK to the vSphere pod. 9. Spherelet reports the mount as a successful event to the control plane API server.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-1B136277-E46C-41FC-9C8C-3E78E9B97F5C.html
Certain Kubernetes workloads require persistent storage to store data permanently. To provision persistent storage for Kubernetes workloads, vSphere with Tanzu integrates with Cloud Native Storage (CNS), a vCenter Server component that manages persistent volumes.

questions.question_text:
A developer is deploying pods with Persistent Volumes (PV) on vSphere with Tanzu.
Which component determines the datastore that the PV will be placed on?

discussion.content:
C
Ingress plays an indirect role by routing traffic to services that might have routable IPs.

Selected Answer: B
Ingress IP Pool Network Routable
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/services/vcf-developer-ready-infrastructure-v1/GUID-AF178A31-D09A-4265-89FD-5987D1B36757.html

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing networking for a developer-ready infrastructure on VMware Cloud Foundation. During the discussion with the network team, a question comes up about the use of a routable CIDR range.
Which item uses this type of range?
Which statement is true regarding NSX Manager configuration in a VMware Cloud Foundation environment?

choices.C: The cluster virtual IP address is used for API and GUI access to NSX Managers.
choices.B: The cluster virtual IP address is attached to all NSX Managers.
choices.A: NSX Managers can be deployed to different VLANs.
choices.D: Traffic is load-balanced across all NSX Managers while using the virtual IP address.
